gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਘਨਘੋਰ ਮੋਰ ਚਾਤ੍ਰਕ ਸਨੇਹ ਗਤਿ ਬਰਖਤ ਮੇਹ ਅਸਨੇਹ ਕੈ ਦਿਖਾਵਹੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Ghanaghor Mor Chaatrak Sanayh Gati , Barakhat Mayh Asanayh Kai Dikhaavahee ?
translation: Just as a peacock's and rain-bird's love is confined to the thunder of the clouds and this love is visible only till the rain lasts. (Their love is not lasting.)

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਤੳੁ ਕਮਲ ਜਲ ਅੰਤਰਿ ਦਿਸੰਤਰਿ ਹੁੲਿ ਮਧੁਕਰ ਦਿਨਕਰ ਹੇਤ ੳੁਪਜਾਵਹੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Tau Kamal Jal Antari Disantari Hui , Madhoukar Dinakar Hayt Oupajaavahee ?
translation: Just as a lotus flower closes at sunset but remains in water and the bumble bee keeps hovering over other flowers. But at sunrise when lotus flower opens up, its love for the lotus flower resurfaces. His love is not of permanent nature.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਦਰ ਨਿਰਾਦਰ ਹੁੲਿ ਜੀਅਤਿ ਪਵਨ ਭਖਿ ਜਲ ਤਜਿ ਮਾਰਤ ਨ ਪ੍ਰੇਮਹਿ ਲਜਾਵਹੀ
transliteration: Daadar Niraadar Hui Jeeati Pavan Bhakhi , Jal Taji Maarat N Praymahi Lajaavahee ?
translation: A frog's love with water is very disrespecting. He comes out of water to breathe air. Out of water, it does not die. He thus shames his love for water.

gurmukhi: ਕਪਟ ਸਨੇਹੀ ਤੈਸੇ ਅਾਨ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵਕੁ ਹੈ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਮੀਨ ਜਲ ਹੇਤ ਠਹਰਾਵਹੀ ॥੪੪੨॥
transliteration: Kapat Sanayhee Taisay Aan Dayv Sayvaku Hai , Gursikh Meen Jal Hayt Tthaharaavahee ?442?
translation: Similarly, a deceitful Sikh with demonstrative love is the follower of other gods and goddesses, whereas the love of a true and obedient Sikh for his True Guru is like fish and water. (He holds no love for anyone else other than the True Guru).  (442)
